2.text: “Shall he who argues contend with the Almighty? He who argues with God, let him answer it.”

4.text: “Behold, I am of small account. What shall I answer you? I lay my hand on my mouth.

5.text: I have spoken once, and I will not answer; Yes, twice, but I will proceed no further.”

6.text: Then Yahweh answered Job out of the whirlwind,

7.text: “Now brace yourself like a man. I will question you, and you will answer me.

8.text: Will you even annul my judgment? Will you condemn me, that you may be justified?

9.text: Or do you have an arm like God? Can you thunder with a voice like him?

10.text: “Now deck yourself with excellency and dignity. Array yourself with honor and majesty.

11.text: Pour out the fury of your anger. Look at everyone who is proud, and bring him low.

12.text: Look at everyone who is proud, and humble him. Crush the wicked in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together. Bind their faces in the hidden place.

14.text: Then I will also admit to you that your own right hand can save you.

15.text: “See now, behemoth, which I made as well as you. He eats grass as an ox.

16.text: Look now, his strength is in his thighs. His force is in the muscles of his belly.

17.text: He moves his tail like a cedar. The sinews of his thighs are knit together.

18.text: His bones are like tubes of brass. His limbs are like bars of iron.

19.text: He is the chief of the ways of God. He who made him gives him his sword.

20.text: Surely the mountains produce food for him, where all the animals of the field play.

21.text: He lies under the lotus trees, in the covert of the reed, and the marsh.

22.text: The lotuses cover him with their shade. The willows of the brook surround him.

23.text: Behold, if a river overflows, he doesn’t tremble. He is confident, though the Jordan swells even to his mouth.

24.text: Shall any take him when he is on the watch, or pierce through his nose with a snare?
